Articles.Content:
I was a big time KSP player a few weeks ago, then I took a break, 0.21 suddenly came out and It broke my saves(can't go to space center at flight), Is there any way that I can revert to 0.20? I have a steam copy. I kinda read that the devs are planning or have implented a feature of sort like this. Not sure though.

I know I should have backed it up when I took that break.

Edited July 27, 2013 by lyndonguitar

Huh... dunno much right now. Will edit if I find something

On a side-note, why not create a new save?

Huh... dunno much right now. Will edit if I find something

On a side-note, why not create a new save?

The main point of reverting is to be able to continue my game(and mods), Besides, 0.21 haven't added that much feature besides Space Center, Astronaut and Recover thingy. so guess i can pass for now

Always always backup....

Also:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/content.php/181-A-New-Old-Feature%21-Previous-Stable-Release-now-available%21

Thanks, I tried to do that earlier and It doesn't show a "previous", I did that now and It shows, I just hope it's the 0.20, and as I mentioned, I took a break from playing the game, didn't anticipate a new update, forgot to disable steam autoupdate. and bam, when I ran the game it's 0.21 already

EDIT: K, It worked, ty

Edited July 27, 2013 by lyndonguitar

Probably a stupid question but I went to KSP's Previous Stable Release Page because I too am having problems. I just bought the game with Steam not long before this update so I don't know steam or kerbal very well. Where do I find the "Steam Game Settings" for Kerbal? Is it in game? Is it in Steam? Is it on my computer somewhere in a file? Any help would be beneficial. I just want to build my rockets again and get back in space. I tried the new one and it doesn't let me build a rocket because it stops responding to my build and makes me exit by a hard reboot (it doesn't freeze per say but won't let me build or exit just sits there and allows me to move around inside the VAB).

Thanks in advance for any help.
